projects.title: Unified Logging and Traceability System for Usability Studies
projects.description: This project aims to implement a structured logging and traceability system that records all relevant events during a usability study lifecycle.
keyFeatures: Study Lifecycle Logging
Multi-Layer Logs (technical, methodological, AI decisions)
Research Traceability
Export & Visualization Tools
Ethics & Anonymization Support
projects.expectedOutcome: A comprehensive logging framework for scientific-grade usability research.

projects.title: Implementation of A/B Testing Capability in RUXAILAB
projects.description: This project focuses on implementing A/B testing functionality within RUXAILAB to enhance usability evaluation and data-driven decision-making. The goal is to provide an integrated system for running controlled experiments, comparing different UI designs, and gathering insights on user preferences.
keyFeatures: Automated A/B Test Setup: Allow testers to configure and manage A/B tests within RUXAILAB
Real-Time Performance Tracking: Collect user interaction data for different variations
Statistical Analysis Module: Provide insights on test results using key performance indicators
User Segmentation: Enable tests based on demographic, behavior, or experience level
Seamless UI Integration: Ensure compatibility with existing usability testing workflows
projects.expectedOutcome: A fully integrated A/B testing module that allows usability researchers to conduct controlled experiments and make data-driven design decisions in RUXAILAB

projects.title: Enhancing Playwright Testing in RUXAILAB
projects.description: This project aims to refine and optimize Playwright-based automated testing in RUXAILAB, improving test efficiency and documentation to enhance maintainability and ease of use. The focus will be on ensuring robust test coverage, optimizing test workflows, and developing comprehensive documentation to support contributors.
keyFeatures: Improving Test Maintainability: Refactor test scripts for better reusability and efficiency
Cross-Browser and Device Compatibility: Ensure consistent behavior across different browsers and devices
Accessibility Testing Enhancements: Strengthen WCAG compliance validation for UI components
Comprehensive Documentation: Develop detailed guides on test creation, execution, and maintenance
Integration with CI/CD Pipelines: Enhance GitHub Actions workflows for streamlined automated testing
projects.expectedOutcome: A more maintainable and well-documented Playwright testing framework, ensuring long-term usability and ease of contribution in RUXAILAB

projects.title: Cognitive Walkthrough Evaluation Module
projects.description: This project aims to implement Cognitive Walkthrough as a core usability evaluation methodology in RUXAILAB. The focus is on systematically evaluating task learnability by analyzing whether users can understand and successfully perform actions step by step, especially during first-time or infrequent use.
keyFeatures: Task-Centered Evaluation Flow: Guide evaluators through predefined tasks broken into interaction steps
Standard Cognitive Walkthrough Questions: Support classic questions related to goal formation, action visibility, feedback interpretation, and system response
Learnability Issue Capture: Record breakdowns related to discoverability, affordances, and user expectations
Structured Findings Model: Store issues linked to specific steps, heuristics, and severity levels
Integrated Reporting: Generate walkthrough-specific reports compatible with RUXAILABâ€™s reporting system
projects.expectedOutcome: A fully integrated Cognitive Walkthrough module that enables systematic identification of learnability and first-use usability problems in digital interfaces.

projects.title: Focus Group Management and Analysis Module
projects.description: This project focuses on implementing Focus Group support in RUXAILAB, enabling structured collection and analysis of qualitative insights gathered through moderated group discussions. The goal is to support early-stage exploration, concept validation, and collective reflection on user experiences.
keyFeatures: Session Configuration Tools: Define focus group objectives, discussion guides, and participant roles
Multi-Participant Data Capture: Support notes, timestamps, transcriptions, and optional audio/video references
Thematic Structuring: Organize observations by topics, prompts, and emerging themes
Consensus and Divergence Tracking: Highlight shared opinions and conflicting perspectives across participants
NLP-Assisted Analysis: Apply basic NLP to cluster themes and summarize discussion outcomes
projects.expectedOutcome: A Focus Group module that enables systematic collection, structuring, and analysis of qualitative group-based usability insights within RUXAILAB.
